passage_text: It is important to keep your dog's nails trimmed. BananaStock/BananaStock/Getty Images. A dog’s nails grow continuously, much in the same way as a humans. It is vitally important that you keep your dog’s nails trimmed down, as safety and health concerns exist for dogs with overgrown nails.

Groomers usually include the cost of a nail clipping in the cost of a grooming package. A full grooming can cost anywhere from $30 to $90, depending on the size of your dog. This includes clipping the nails, trimming the ear hair, washing and drying the dog, and clipping the hair into a certain style.

Answer: nail trim... why... how to do... It's almost a necessity to sedate some dogs and cats for their nail trim, also called a pedicure, because of their self-protective nature regarding their paws and toes. If the nail trim is really necessary it should be done in the safest and most compassionate way.

1 Bath-only grooming -- with bath, ear cleaning and nail trimming -- on a non-matted dog costs less than full grooming -- usually 50 to 75 percent of the price. 2  This is most common for dogs with very short hair.

For your vet to tell you this .... your dog MUST have some seriously overgrown nails !!!! The only time they sedate a dog to trim their nails is when they are so terribly overgrown that they need to quick the nails to get them to a reasonable length. This is painful, so they have to sedate the dog. They would just muzzle an uncooperative dog to trim them.
